title: rustup on mint fails with "empty installer version"
body:
I've tried installing the beta version of rust on mint 17.1, using rustup.sh as described on the install page. However, running rustup fails with the following error

```
》 sudo ./rustup.sh    
[sudo] password for m: 
rustup: gpg available. signatures will be verified
rustup: downloading manifest for 'beta'
rustup: downloading toolchain for 'beta'
######################################################################## 100,0%
gpg: Signature made Fri 17 Apr 2015 05:07:37 AM CEST using RSA key ID 7B3B09DC
gpg: Good signature from "Rust Language (Tag and Release Signing Key) <rust-key@rust-lang.org>"
gpg: WARNING: This key is not certified with a trusted signature!
gpg:          There is no indication that the signature belongs to the owner.
Primary key fingerprint: 108F 6620 5EAE B0AA A8DD  5E1C 85AB 96E6 FA1B E5FE
     Subkey fingerprint: C134 66B7 E169 A085 1886  3216 5CB4 A934 7B3B 09DC
rustup: extracting installer
rustup: installing toolchain for 'beta'
install: error: rust installer version is empty. see logs at '/usr/local/lib/rustlib/install.log'
rustup: command failed: sh /home/m/.rustup/tmp/tmp-7877-10/rust-1.0.0-beta.2-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/install.sh --prefix=/usr/local --disable-ldconfig
rustup: failed to install toolchain
```

`/usr/local/lib/rustlib/install.log` doesn't contain any interesting information either, just the line `install: error: rust installer version is empty. see logs at '/usr/local/lib/rustlib/install.log'`
